name: Daniel Kahneman
description: Israeli-American psychologist and economist, Nobel Prize winner who pioneered the field of behavioral economics and studied cognitive biases in decision-making
philosophy: Nothing in life is as important as you think it is, while you are thinking about it.
quotes: The confidence people have in their beliefs is not a measure of the quality of evidence but of the coherence of the story the mind has managed to construct
A reliable way to make people believe in falsehoods is frequent repetition
